website_summaries.verdict: A reasonably priced champagne glass with a classic look and design that comes in various set sizes.
pros: The glasses are well made with polished rims
They're lightweight and easy to handle but feature a sturdy construction
In addition, the glasses are easy to clean since they can be popped in the dishwasher without being damaged
cons: They are on the shorter side compared to other champagne glasses

customer_reviews.title: I love these glasses for drinking my beer
customer_reviews.text: I love these glasses for drinking my beer! They hold the whole beer in one pour, the head is contained and the flavor is enhanced. I drink beer all over the world. In many places they will serve you a been in a similar shaped glass. This glass is as good or better than the glass I drank the excellent beer from. They are so refined, delicate and yet durable I really do like to drink my beer from them. I still can't believe how nice they are. It is a real treat to drink a beer from these beautiful glasses. Redel makes great glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Wyodrill

customer_reviews.title: Not authentic and arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: First, I ordered 12 and 3 arrived broken. Second, and more concerning, is that the bottoms are stamped "Riedel 001", not simply "Riedel." Googling that, it turns out I was sold Riedel's "Restaurant Series" glasses that are only available at wholesale, not authentic Riedel Ouverture glasses. The former series of glass is sold for roughly $4 per glass while the latter type goes for $14-$15 per glass ($15 directly from Riedel). My hope is this was an accidental shipping mistake and will be immediately corrected by the seller. My experience on Amazon has always been great - I hope this isn't a sign of what's to come.
customer_reviews.author: Fair Shake

customer_reviews.title: Relax, get your swirl on, and enjoy the wine!
customer_reviews.text: I think Reidel glasses have the perfect shape for enhancing enjoyment of any red wine. Compared to the Vinum (or higher) series of Reidels, and I find the shorter profile and slightly thicker (though plenty thin enough!) stems and bowls make it easier to focus on enjoying the wine, rather than worrying about tipping over or breaking the glass. They're only about ten bucks each, so it's no Shakespearian tragedy if one gets broken at a dinner party.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Millett

customer_reviews.title: Love these glasses
customer_reviews.text: These are huge, but that’s a good thing. Lots of room to swirl. I’m tempted to get rid of all my other glasses because these are so much better. Was looking for the smaller glass in the second photo but apparently it’s no longer available from Riedel. That one was found at a thrift store and seemed quite large to me. These were as close to it as I could find and they dwarf it. Didn’t rate sturdiness and durability (is there a difference?) because I’ve used them only a few times, but I suspect they’re quite fragile. I wash them very carefully by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: A real value deal
customer_reviews.text: One of the boxes had 1 glass that was broken but Amazon was very good in the replacement since we were using a courier company (they were great too) to ship the items to Seoul, South Korea. The glasses are wonderful for price. I think it is well made and as mentioned, you could use it either for water or beer. Weighted slightly at the stem and you will not feel it is too delicate because if it. Most people are happy to drink beer out of the bottle or can these days, but it will be so nice to have them on the table visually plus it's more classy to drink out of a glass :-)

customer_reviews.title: Nice short glasses

Most "modern" wine glasses are 9 or more inches tall, but the old cabinets in my kitchen don't have any shelves with more than 8.5 inches of clearance. These met all of my requirements - they fit in my cabinets and they have a nice big bowl to swirl and collect aromas. The glass is reasonably thin, but not so much I feel like they'll break easily.
